cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north then turning north-northeast toward the southwest Louisiana coast, with the center forecast to cross the Cameron/Lake Charles area and then move inland across central Louisiana.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cameron, Louisiana (just south-southwest of Lake Charles)

weather_observation.warning_coast: High Island, TX to Morgan City, LA (includes Lake Charles/Cameron)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast through south-central Louisiana, highest impacts southwest and south-central Louisiana including Calcasieu and Vermilion Bays
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (sustained 74–110 mph) possible at port Friday afternoon through late Friday evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Calcasieu Lake and adjacent coast 2–4 ft, locally 3–5 ft Sabine Pass to Holly Beach; higher 5–8 ft just east of the port toward Rockefeller Refuge.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated totals up to 15 inches; significant flash, urban, and river flooding likely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in Delta’s rainbands; life-threatening surf and rip currents; rapid water-level rise in canals and the ship channel.
